SFM.description: File identification (BOOKID, FILENAME, EDITOR, MODIFICATION DATE)
Running header text for a book (basic)
Running header text, left side of page
Running header text, right side of page
For a comment or note inserted for liturgical use
Second (alternate) chapter number (for coding dual versification; useful for places where different traditions of chapter breaks need to be supported in the same translation)
Chapter label used for translations that add a word such as 'Chapter' before chapter numbers (e.g. Psalms). The subsequent text is the chapter label.
Published chapter number (this is a chapter marking that would be used in the published text)
Chapter Description (Publishing option D, e.g. in Russian Bibles)
Second (alternate) verse number (for coding dual numeration in Psalms; see also NRSV Exo 22.1-4)
Published verse marker - this is a verse marking that would be used in the published text
The main title of the book (if single level)
The main title of the book (if multiple levels) (basic)
A secondary title usually occurring before the main title (basic)
A secondary title occurring after the main title
A small secondary title sometimes occuring within parentheses
The main title of the book repeated at the end of the book (if single level)
SFM.styleName: mte - Title - [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 1

SFM.description: The main title of the book repeated at the end of the book (if multiple levels)
SFM.styleName: mte1 - Title - [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 1

SFM.description: A secondary title occurring before or after the 'ending' main title
SFM.styleName: mte2 - Title - [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 2

SFM.description: A major section division heading, level 1 (if single level) (basic)
A major section division heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)
A major section division heading, level 2
A major section division heading, level 3
A section heading, level 1 (if single level) (basic)
A section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)
A section heading, level 3 (e.g. Genesis 'The First Day')
A section division references range heading
A heading, to identify the speaker (e.g. Job) (basic)
A Hebrew text heading, to provide description (e.g. Psalms)
SFM.styleName: d - Heading - Descriptive Title - Hebrew Subtitle
di - Descr title or Heb subtitle di

SFM.description: A major section division references range heading (basic)
SFM.styleName: mr - Heading - Major Section Range References

SFM.description: The cross reference target reference(s), protocanon only (basic)
A cross-reference quotation from the scripture text
Cross-reference target reference(s), Old Testament only
SFM.styleName: xot...xot* - Cross Reference - OT Target Refs (optional)

SFM.description: Cross-reference target reference(s), New Testament only
SFM.styleName: xnt...xnt* - Cross Reference - NT Target Refs (optional)
xdc...xdc* - Cross Reference - DC Target Refs

SFM.description: A cross-reference indicating the source text for the preceding quotation
SFM.styleName: rq...rq* - Cross Reference - Inline Quotation References

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with first line indent (basic)
SFM.styleName: p - Paragraph - Normal - First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if sinlge level), with first line indent; often used for discourse (basic)
SFM.styleName: pi - Paragraph - Indented - Level 1 - First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels), with first line indent; often used for discourse
SFM.styleName: pi1 - Paragraph - Indented - Level 1 - First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, level 2 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse
SFM.styleName: pi2 - Paragraph - Indented - Level 2 - First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, level 3 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse
SFM.styleName: pi3 - Paragraph - Indented - Level 3 - First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with level 1 hanging indent (if single level)
SFM.styleName: DEPRECATED ph - Paragraph - Hanging Indent - Level 1

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with level 1 hanging indent (if multiple levels)
SFM.styleName: DEPRECATED ph1 - Paragraph - Hanging Indent - Level 1

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with level 2 hanging indent
SFM.styleName: DEPRECATED ph2 - Paragraph - Hanging Indent - Level 2

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with level 3 hanging indent
SFM.styleName: DEPRECATED ph3 - Paragraph - Hanging Indent - Level 3

SFM.description: Paragraph text, indented with hanging indent
SFM.styleName: DEPRECATED phi - Paragraph - Indented - Hanging Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry) (basic)
SFM.styleName: m - Paragraph - Margin - No First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent; often used for discourse
SFM.styleName: mi - Paragraph - Indented - No First Line Indent

SFM.description: Paragraph text, no break with next paragraph text at chapter boundary
SFM.styleName: OBSOLETE ps - Paragraph - No Break with Next Paragraph

SFM.description: Paragraph text, indented, with no break with next paragraph text (at chapter boundary)
SFM.styleName: OBSOLETE psi - Paragraph - Indented - No Break with Next

SFM.description: Embedded text refrain (e.g. Then all the people shall say, 'Amen!')
Paragraph text, with no break from previous paragraph text (at chapter boundary) (basic)
SFM.styleName: nb - Paragraph - No Break with Previous Paragraph
cls - Paragraph - Closure of an Epistle

SFM.description: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if single level)
SFM.styleName: q - Poetry - Indent Level 1 - Single Level Only

SFM.description: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels) (basic)
Poetry text, Acrostic markup of the first character of a line of acrostic poetry
Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if single level)
SFM.styleName: qm - Poetry - Embedded Text - Indent Level 1 - Single Level Only

SFM.description: Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if multiple levels)
SFM.styleName: qm1 - Poetry - Embedded Text - Indent Level 1
qm2 - Poetry - Embedded Text - Indent Level 2
qm3 - Poetry - Embedded Text - Indent Level 3

SFM.description: The origin reference for the footnote (basic)
A footnote scripture quote or alternate rendering (basic)
SFM.styleName: fq - Footnote - Quotation or Alternate Rendering

SFM.description: A footnote alternate rendering for a portion of scripture text
A footnote label text item, for marking or 'labelling' the type or alternate translation being provided in the note.
Footnote text, applies to Deuterocanon only
A verse number within the footnote text
An additional footnote marker location for a previous footnote
SFM.styleName: fm - Footnote - Additional Caller to Previous Note

SFM.description: For Old Testament quoted text appearing in the New Testament (basic)
SFM.styleName: qt...qt* - Special Text - Quoted Text - OT in NT
nd...nd* - Special Text - Name of Deity

SFM.description: Deuterocanonical/LXX additions or insertions in the Protocanonical text
For the quoted name of a book
SFM.styleName: bk...bk* - Special Text - Quoted book title

SFM.description: For the signature of the author of an Epistle
For marking the words of Jesus
SFM.styleName: wj...wj* - Special Text - Words of Jesus

SFM.description: To represent where the original text is in a secondary language or from an alternate text source
SFM.styleName: sls...sls* - Special Text - Secondary Language or Text Source

SFM.description: For the text portion of an ordinal number
SFM.styleName: ord...ord* - Special Text - Ordinal number text portion

SFM.description: For a translational addition to the text
A character style, use normal text
A character style, use bold text
A character style, use italic text
A character style, use bold + italic text
A character style, use emphasized text style
A character style, for small capitalization text
For indicating pronunciation in CJK texts
Introduction main title, level 1 (if single level) (basic)
Introduction major title, level 1 (if multiple levels)
Introduction major title, level 4 (usually within parenthesis)
Introduction major title at introduction end, level 1 (if single level)
SFM.styleName: imte - Introduction - [Uncommon] Major Title at Introduction End Level 1

SFM.description: Introduction major title at introduction end, level 1 (if multiple levels)
SFM.styleName: imte1 - Introduction - [Uncommon] Major Title at Introduction End Level 1

SFM.description: Introduction major title at introduction end, level 2
SFM.styleName: imte2 - Introduction - [Uncommon] Major Title at Introduction End Level 2

SFM.description: Introduction section heading, level 1 (if single level) (basic)
Introduction section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)
Introduction prose paragraph, indented, with first line indent
SFM.styleName: ipi - Introduction - Indented Para - first line indent

SFM.description: Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text
SFM.styleName: ipq - Introduction - Paragraph - quote from text

SFM.description: Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if single level)
Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if multiple levels)
Introduction prose paragraph, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry)
SFM.styleName: im - Introduction - Paragraph - no first line indent

SFM.description: Introduction prose paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent
SFM.styleName: imi - Introduction - Indented Para - no first line indent

SFM.description: A list entry, level 1 (if single level)
A list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)
Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text, with no first line indent
SFM.styleName: imq - Introduction - Paragraph - quote from text - no first line indent

SFM.description: Introduction outline text, level 1 (if single level)
Introduction outline text, level 1 (if multiple levels) (basic)
Introduction references range for outline entry; for marking references separately
Introduction explanatory or bridge text (e.g. explanation of missing book in Short Old Testament)
SFM.styleName: iex - Introduction - Explanatory or Bridge Text

SFM.description: For quoted scripture text appearing in the introduction
SFM.styleName: iqt...iqt* - Special Text - Quoted Scripture Text in Introduction

SFM.description: A list entry, level 1 (if single level)
A list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

wh...wh* - Peripheral Ref - Hebrew Wordlist Entry
wg...wg* - Peripheral Ref - Greek Wordlist Entry
ndx...ndx* - Peripheral Ref - Subject Index Entry

SFM.description: Periheral content division marker which should be followed by an additional division argument/title.

SFM.styleName: p2 - Periph - Front/Back Matter Paragraph Level 2

SFM.description: Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 1
Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 2
Concordance and Names Index markup for an alternate entry target reference.
SFM.styleName: xtSee - Concordance and Names Index - Alternate Entry Target Reference

SFM.description: Concordance and Names Index markup for an additional entry target reference.
SFM.styleName: xtSeeAlso - Concordance and Names Index - Additional Entry Target Reference
OBSOLETE pub Peripherals - Front Matter Publication Data
OBSOLETE toc Peripherals - Front Matter Table of Contents
toc1 - File - Long Table of Contents Text
toc2 - File - Short Table of Contents Text
OBSOLETE pref Peripherals - Front Matter Preface
OBSOLETE intro Peripherals - Front Matter Introduction
OBSOLETE conc Peripherals - Back Matter Concordance
OBSOLETE glo Peripherals - Back Matter Glossary
OBSOLETE idx Peripherals - Back Matter Index
OBSOLETE maps Peripherals - Back Matter Map Index

SFM.description: Page Break used for new reader portions and children's bibles where content is controlled by the page
Poetry text stanza break (e.g. stanza break) (basic)
Illustration [Columns to span, height, filename, caption text]
For chinese words to be dot underline and underline
ID or Caller for an extended (study) note. Used within a source project duplicte (target) text when autoring study material.
